Friday FARA update — Hastert fall out — Clinton's speech at AHIP not his first — Internet Association to teach staffers to Snap, Gram and more

With Cate Martel and Matt Yurus

FRIDAY FARA UPDATE — JAPAN HIRES ONE MORE: The Government of Japan has hired McBee Strategic Consulting for its “experts exchange program,” according to documents filed under the Foreign Agents Registration Act.

“For each Individual, McBee Strategic will be expected to arrange several meetings with American intellectuals, think tank organizations and scholastic institutions across the country, although primarily in Washington, DC, the intent is to foster better understanding and stronger relationships between the United States and Japan,” the documents state.

PLAYBOOK THEFT — PELLETIER TO ALIBABA GROUP: Alibaba Group, one of the world’s largest Internet companies, has hired Eric Pelletier, a GE Capital executive who worked in the White House of President George W. Bush, as head of international government affairs, based in Washington.

INTERNET ASSOCIATION TO TEACH STAFFERS TO SNAP, GRAM AND MORE: The Internet Association is hosting a Capitol Hill staff-only briefing featuring Instagram, Periscope, Reddit, Snapchat and Tumblr in an effort to highlight alternative platforms to congressional offices.

Story Continued Below

HASTERT FALL OUT — FUELS AMERICA DUMPS DICKSTEIN: Fuels America — indicted former House Speaker Dennis Hastert’s biggest domestic client — has terminated its relationship with Dickstein Shapiro, according to a source with direct knowledge.

NO RAINING ON THE CHAMBER'S PARADE: Despite the rain, the show went on last night for the Chamber’s Global Intellectual Property Center, which turned their rooftop reception into an “under the roof reception," bringing together members of the IP community.
